title: Screen Lock Help!
body:
I have been playing for league for so long and I have never noticed people playing with their screen unlocked until after I was lvl 30. I play decently with all champs on locked screen and yet this is the first moba game I've played and I find it so hard to adjust to playing with my screen unlocked can someone please assist me in providing more info on this such as: 

Hotkeys - I know space can bring you back to your champ and if you hold it, it's like playing lock screen. If their are any other keys could I please get that info.
Tips - I know that lowering mouse and game sensitivity can help me practice but are their also any other methods?
Game - If u wouldn't mind showing me in game tutorials or gamers to recommend it really helps.

I've also been playing lee sin and katarina recently and I see that when I wanted to kill someone who's under tower that is really low I went to flash then shunpo as kat and the locked screen moved as I flashed so my cursor had slightly moved off its target when I wanted to shunpo in for the kill (I still got the kill after I flashed anyways). This play has been tempting to try playing with my screen unlocked and I can see the advantages it has to advancing my gameplay in the future, It would be a big help If someone could really assist me in these areas but other than that thank you for your time and I'm open to suggestions. <3

replies.body:
Krepo (former Pro Support player) played with a Lock Screen. It's not the worst, but being able to play without it helps.

You can rebind the spacebar to be a Toggle lockscreen instead of having to hold it.

When i decided to change myself to non-locked I just played vs AI for a bit. Took about 5-6 games and I got used to it.
thanks man im sorry this is sorta late but ty for the comment :) this helps alot
Y is the lock screen default key or you can pres f9 for a bordered lock screen
